info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:17PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN RIPLEY AND SOUTHWESTERN DEARBORN COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 217 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 10 miles south of Versailles, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Milan, Dillsboro, Moores Hill, Farmers Retreat, Friendship, Cross Plains, Rexville, Cold Springs, Benham and Olean. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
